sentence.Network_en: When he died, his family was left completely destitute.
When Mr. Smith died, his wife and childern were left destitute.
sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯先生死后, 他的妻儿变得一贫如洗.

sentence.Network_en: When Mr. Smith died, his wife and children were left destitute.
sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯先生死时, 他的妻子和孩子都陷入贫困.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'deserted, abandoned, empty'): from Latin destitutus, past participle of destituere 'forsake', from de- 'away from' + statuere 'to place'

entry.tran: 赤贫的;贫困的;一无所有的
entry.def: Someone who is destitute has no money or possessions.

example.ex: ...destitute children who live on the streets.

means.word_mean: 1. poor enough to need help from others

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The average man is destitute of independence of opinion.

auth_sentence.content: The United Nations says these people are destitute.

auth_sentence.content: It is actually destitute of any serious commitment.

stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,没有+stitut建立+e→没有建立→缺乏的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 构成,构造,组成[方式],成分;体格;宪法

stems_affixes.value_cn: 穷困, 缺乏, 贫穷

pro前面+stitut建立,放+e→放在路前面
restitute[v.复原,归还]+ion表名词→n.归还,赔偿
sub下面+stitut建立,放+e→在下面放着→代替
